bibl.title: Letter from John R. Vaughan to Howard A. Kelly, January 14, 1903

div1.p: Vaughan requests that a letter in support of the pension bill be sent to the Washington Post.

div1.head: Letter from John R. Vaughan to Howard A. Kelly, January 14, 1903
div1.opener:

Norfolk. Va. Jany 14th 1903
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
Dr. Howard Kelly
Baltimore Md
My dear hi/
div1.p:
The friends of the late Dr, Walter
Reed, in the Medical Corps at Washington, are
pushing the pension claims for his widow,
aided by few Senators, but they will need all
the aid they can get to push it through I think,
and in a letter from Major Kean yesterday he
suggested that if some influential man, like
yourself, would write a letter say to the
Washington Post, setting forth the facts fully
on which a decent pension should be allowed
the Widow of Dr Reed, that it would help
materially in the work we are trying to
accomplish, as the Post is generally read by
the members of Congress, besides the Post has
been very profuse in Dr Reed's praises in many
ways. I feel deeply interested in a private
pension for Mrs Reed, as her husband left her
but little of this world's goods, and I hope I am
